metadata.Title: CVE-2020-22031 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A Heap-based Buffer Overflow vulnerability exists in FFmpeg 4.2 at libavfilter/vf_w3fdif.c in filter16_complex_low, which might lead to memory corruption and other potential consequences.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2020-22031` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:4.4-6ubuntu5
libavcodec-extra - 7:4.4-6ubuntu5
libavcodec-extra58 - 7:4.4-6ubuntu5
libavcodec58 - 7:4.4-6ubuntu5
libavdevice58 - 7:4.4-6ubuntu5
libavfilter-extra - 7:4.4-6ubuntu5
libavfilter-extra7 - 7:4.4-6ubuntu5
libavfilter7 - 7:4.4-6ubuntu5
libavformat-extra - 7:4.4-6ubuntu5
libavformat-extra58 - 7:4.4-6ubuntu5
libavformat58 - 7:4.4-6ubuntu5
libavutil56 - 7:4.4-6ubuntu5
libpostproc55 - 7:4.4-6ubuntu5
libswresample3 - 7:4.4-6ubuntu5
libswscale5 - 7:4.4-6ubuntu5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ffmpeg package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7:4.4-6ubuntu5').
